com.cleo.lexicom.external

Interface IActionController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IHostActionController

    public interface IActionController
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Establishes an interface for sequentially issuing action commands and streaming throughput. Refer to ILexiCom.getActionController(String[]). Also refer to ISessionScript.getMailboxController() and its variants.

      • build

        LexCommand build(java.lang.String[] options,
                 java.lang.String command,
                 java.lang.String source,
                 java.lang.String destination,
                 java.util.Properties parameters)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Builds a VersaLex command from its components
        Parameters:
        options - the command options (-ASC, -UNI, ...)
        command - the command name (e.g. PUT, GET, SET, ...)
        source - the command source file path
        destination - the command destination file path
        parameters - any additional command parameters (e.g. Content-Type=EDIFACT)
        Returns:
        LexCommand
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

  throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:

      • getHostProtocol

        int getHostProtocol()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the protocol for the action's host
        Returns:
        either HTTP_CLIENT/_SERVER, FTP_CLIENT/_SERVER, OFTP_CLIENT, SSHFTP_CLIENT/_SERVER, MQ_CLIENT, SMTP_CLIENT, or MLLP_CLIENT
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMailboxPackaging

        int getMailboxPackaging()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the packaging for the mailbox
        Returns:
        either NONE, AS2, AS3, ebMS, OpenPGP, XML Encryption
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        boolean isRunning()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns true if action is running
        Returns:
        true if action is running
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • join

        void join(long millis)
   throws java.lang.Exception
        Waits for the action to finish. A timeout of 0 means to wait forever. This method is not with respect to actions being run through the API
        Parameters:
        millis - the time to wait in milliseconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                                      throws java.lang.Exception

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Throws:
